item.title: British Inquiry Finds Iraq War Lacked Legal Justification
item.description:
British Inquiry Finds Iraq War Lacked Legal Justification

After the long awaited release of the Chilcot report, many say British and US leaders should be held accountable for violating international law

item.title: Live at Truthdig: Does the U.S. Need Its Own Chilcot Report?
item.description:
Live at Truthdig: Does the U.S. Need Its Own Chilcot Report?

Early Thursday morning, a British inquiry into the Iraq War released a report condemning former Prime Minister Tony Blair and the British government's role in joining the U.S. invasion. The Chilcot report-named after the chairman of the investigation, John Chilcot-took seven years to produce and contains 2.6 million words.

item.title: In Unprecedented Decision, Europe Will Sanction Spain, Portugal Over Deficits While Ignoring French, Italian Violations
item.description:
In Unprecedented Decision, Europe Will Sanction Spain, Portugal Over Deficits While Ignoring French, Italian Violations

Confirming yet again that just like in the US, "some are more equal than others", moments ago the European Commission announced that it would seek sanctions for Spain and Portugal for breaching limits on budget deficits in an unprecedented step to enforce rules designed to prevent another debt crisis.

item.title: George Galloway Owns A Oxford Uni Student!
item.description:
George Galloway Owns A Oxford Uni Student!

George Galloway shows his stance on Gay Rights and Hugo Chavez in response to a student who refers to him as a 'homophobic'. İcerik giriniz

item.title: Confessions of an Economic Hitman - John Perkins | Short Documentary
item.description:
Confessions of an Economic Hitman - John Perkins | Short Documentary

According to Perkins, he began writing Confessions of an Economic Hit Man in the 1980s, but "threats or bribes always convinced [him] to stop." According to his book, Perkins' function was to convince the political and financial leadership of underdeveloped countries to accept enormous development loans from institutions like the World Bank and USAID.

item.title: Peter Schiff educates misguided people at occupy wall street.
item.description:
Peter Schiff educates misguided people at occupy wall street.

In this RT video Economist and Investor Peter Schiff seeks to educate some misguided people on the value of a "TRUE free market system and real capitalism.

item.title: Hillary Still Possibly Under Investigation for Clinton Foundation
item.description:
Hillary Still Possibly Under Investigation for Clinton Foundation

Comey had announced Tuesday that he would not recommend prosecuting Hillary Clinton for mishandling classified information, despite the fact that her behavior was "extremely careless." However, Comey did not say anything about investigation into the Clinton Foundation, which now still appears to be ongoing.

item.title: George Galloway Senate Testimony (FULL)
item.description:
George Galloway Senate Testimony (FULL)

May 17, 2005 British Member of Parliament George Galloway testified at a hearing on how Saddam Hussein manipulated the United Nations' Oil-for-Food Program to win influence and reward friends in order to undermine sanctions imposed on Iraq following the Persian Gulf War. A committee report on alleged abuses of the program had named Minister Galloway as one of several foreign officials who had received lucrative oil allocations in the scheme.
